comment: amazing lectures that make sense imo. do your work and go see him to get things done, very helpful and mostly available. step by step learning recipe. and labs help you see things clearly and connect the dots. four tests and four labs, that is it.

Great experience, straightforward things to do that led to tests from important concepts. Quizzes before tests got us to focus. project led to college competition that one of our team won. awesome all in all!

to the point lecture videos and straightforward tests with warmup quizzes. Easy A if you pay attention and work reasonably tbh. He and TA accessible if you are stuck on something. Definitely, would do again.
Great experience with full support and good learning opportunity. Help available every step in the way of you use it.

Wasn't that bad tbh. He gave like so many videos and sources on d2l for help. Exams were pretty understandable and comes from the practice problems. Wouldn't be a bad choice for a professor in this course, but yeah this course is still very difficult.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Accessible outside class--Online Savvy

comment: Doable tests after practice problem solving. labs need time, help is available every step in the way. Tough material made understandable.

This is a very difficult class, with far too much content crammed into one semester, but Professor Majeed handles it relatively well. You will need to watch the videos and leave about a week (at least) to complete each lab (especially the ones in multisim). Tests are pretty straight forward, but you need to watch the materials and attend lecutres.

Half grade from tests and other half from labs. Tests straight from what's covered in practice problems. Middle labs need time so start early and seek abundantly available help. Very approachable if you try office hours. manage time and listen carefully as lectures important.

He's a good professor but there is too much information packed into one course which makes it difficult for him to properly explain and hard for students to understand and retain information. The labs were difficult and can seem overwhelming, so start early on those if you can. Tests and quizzes are not that difficult.

Assigned a project due over spring break after holding an exam the class right before break. After dealing with midterms before break and studying for the exam this felt like walking on legos to have to work on a project everyone was struggling with in our supposed "free time". Take it online.

He said we would post lectures online and do practice problems in class. Not enough people watched lectures by his unspoken due dates, so he lectured through most classes. When he did practice problems, he often worked them halfway or skipped them because we should know. There weren't answer keys for homework, so you couldn't learn/fix your work.

Professor Majeed is demanding, but his class was fascinating. He deeply understands the subject matter of the class, unlike some other CS professors. His Computer Org & Arch class was probably the most interesting class I've ever taken at KSU. His quizzes and tests can be confusing at times, but he always granted adjustments or retakes.

Ehhhh. Ok, Majeed is enthusiastic, but that's about the only positive. The materials and structure for this class are pretty bottom barrel. No homework, just a few typed up questions he makes but doesn't give you the answers to! So it's just the recorded lectures, and then show back up to class for the same thing in person. Then projects and tests.

Literally anyone would be better than this professor. Regardless of how much one studied, everyone would fail every test and quiz. Did not follow the syllabus at all, and for projects we had to use incredibly outdated software that was barely functional. Had to watch hours of lecture videos outside of class just to do the same exact thing in class.
rating_tags: Group projects--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: This professor did not teach the relevant material well, along with using standards from the late 90s that no one uses anymore (like multisim ni, masm), forcing everyone to use windows instead of using accessible standards that run everywhere like online multisim, nasm, or gas. Also when the entire class wiould fail tests he would blame it on us
rating_tags: Tough grader--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: This professor is not the best for this course. There is too much content and he does not know how to teach it in an absorbable way. He makes us watch hour-long lecture videos at jome and then come in person for even more lecture. No homework. Only quizzes, exams, and optional practice tests. He also enjoys tossing backhanded comments in class...

This course was terrible, beginning to the end. The professor would spend the entire class talking without really covering any material, and what little he covered would make ZERO sense. He would want us to watch his videos before coming to class, but the videos were an hour or more long and were just him talking over a powerpoint, making no sense.

He's an alright professor. It was a difficult class to take online, and the homework was really tough compared to what we went through in his lectures & slides. Definitely prepare to spend quite a bit of time getting your Java programs to run to his expectations.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment:
Brand new to teaching Algorithms. He takes class participation into account for everything. Homework can be kinda tough, but he's willing to help you in office hours. Put in the time and effort, make sure he understands what your question or confusion is, and you'll do fine. He genuinely loves the topic. 
Midterm, 4 homework assignments, & a final.

This professor isn't bad AT ALL, he gives so many chances and curves tests. 4 test and 4 HWs. 1 final that weighs 40% which is crazy but all tests are online but kinda lockdown without the browser and camera. He lectures ALOT and often doesn't have enough time to finish the PPT's but he tries his best to engage the class and make you understand.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Graded by few things--Accessible outside class

comment: If you attend this university, it would be smart to avoid this professor. Offers little to no insight during online lectures. Homework and lecture heavy, but that's just the department, the issue lies in how he as a professor gives no substance to his class. GET READY TO GOOGLE AND SEARCH UP THINGS FOR YOURSELF.

He is a friendly professor but his powerpoints aren't that good so you will have to do some independent research. Other than his lectures not being that good he is lenient with grading and gives second chances if he sees that you are trying.
rating_tags: Group projects--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: Majeed is a new cs professor who originated from the robotics/engineering classes. He told our class we do not need the textbook, however his lectures do not always make sense. His exams are opinion heavy, The biggest benefit of him is he is aware of environmental factors and take those into account when grading. He curves if needed for exams.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Unlike other reviews I see oer here, my opinion over prof. Waqas is quite positive. He gives good lectures and cares about the students. It is true he gives a lot of homework, but I have done really good in his subject without almost having to study for it. Give him a chance, he is a good professor.

Prof. Majeed is a nice person. He does care for his students, but I personally have not learned anything in this class. He has assigned HWs from a different professor and does not cover the material. The CSE department is not helping him either, giving him too many classes and throwing him into the deep end. Good person, but not a good professor

I was weary of taking Dr. Majeed because of negative reviews, but I feel like he has been great. He is very lenient and a very caring professor. This course isn't a cakewalk, but if you do all of your work then you will easily get a B or an A.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: Professor Majeed is always available if you have any question. there is reasonable amount of homework, and final test is easy if you do the homework.

Professor got upset by all the negative ratings so I would like to elaborate why he did not do a good job. You won't learn in the class; part of that is the curriculum being common sense. HW was 100% completion grade, Final was copy and paste of HW questions and was graded for completion plus 5 questions he allegedly checked for accuracy.

Attendance is not mandatory but he grades on attendance and participation. He also made the students present EVERY LECTURE TOPIC while doing nothing except maybe adding a comment at the end of lecture. He doesnt respond to emails (pandemic time) well and he asked our whole class to show up for the last class when the room didnt have the capacity.

This professorI dont know where to begin. He is an easy A, but only after you receive the grade. And what I mean is that there is not outline/rubric/instructions/details on grading. He basically tells you to present a topic without any direction and you literally dont know what to do or if you did it right until you get your grades back.
if youre just trying to get the engineering ethics class out of the way waqas id a solid choice, if you do all the work you cannot fail. the guy posting one star is being dramatic

Hes a nice and caring professor. He made the class really easy. The only test we had was final and its not even hard, we just didnt have much time to answer it and that was the fault of a student for asking to postpone the time bc it was too early in the morning. This class is an easy A.

This "teacher" didn't give any information during the entire semester. All lectures were student made. and no assistance is given. There is a group term paper that is given with no guidance and he never informs students of changes. The final was online from 8am-10:30 am, then 8-10, then 9-10. if that doesn't make sense its because it doesn't.
He understands we have other classes and the current pandemic. His tests come straight from his lecture examples and HW.

He was an understanding teacher that really wants his students to pass. I'm sure the pandemic has made him lenient on attendance but you can get so much from his lectures that help. His tests are similar to homework and with much practice, you'll understand the class. I felt as if I wasn't doing well in the class but he help you more than you think
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Do you expect your professor to cover material? Follow the syllabus? Clarify topics? Test on covered material? Be willing to help students? Teach? Well this is not the professor for you. Changes grading percentages week before the final to screw students. Gets defensive and upset when students ask questions. DO NOT TAKE

He's not so much a tough grader as he is ludicrously inconsistent. Do not take this teacher if you would like to spend the class learning something. If you ask him a question, he will ask a different question and then answer his own question, but never yours.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: Unqualified. Saw the COVID-19 crisis as an opportunity to make test questions as obtuse and time consuming as possible, without ever presenting the material. What little he did present is straight from Dr. Marshall who was pulled from this class at the last minute. Lab is a dumpster fire. This program is a mess, and Majeed will help you feel it.

One of the worst professors I have ever had in my 5 years of college. I would watch videos, think I understand the content, then go to class and his word salad would somehow make it harder to understand. His take home final took me 16 hours (no exaggeration) to complete. He claims that he does not fail people, but you will NOT learn!

Very poor professor, looked like he was learning it a long with us. Was not very accommodating during COVID-19 pandemic. If you have a choice of another professor especially for this class, take the other professor.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy

comment: Majeed thinks he is god's gift to engineering and he isn't. This lab section should have been an easy A. It wasn't because he made us do formal lab reports FOR every single lab. As the semester went on he changed group lab reports to individual ones. He explained things horribly made the labs way harder then they needed to be. 0/10

The slides he uses lack in material so you definitely have to listen during lecture. Even if you do listen in lecture, its still not much helpful because its hard grasping concepts from Dr Majeed. However, he is a caring professor and will definitely hear you out. Hes willing to curve grades, postpone assignments, etc.
He does a very poor job of communicating the material. He obviously is using the same PowerPoint lectures as previous professors but still cannot explain the concepts clearly.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Professor Majeed is a great Statics professor.  He carefully explains everything and complains when no one contributes.  He'll work through at least one problem for every concept.  His tests and quizzes are similar to the homework (out of the book), which is mandatory and pretty easy if you pay attention in class.

Majeed is a pleasant enough man, however, his test questions can be obscure. He is new as of Spring 2015 and teaches straight out of the slides which are based on the book. Test questions are very similar to the slides, however the questions themselves can be confusing. They are difficult not bc the material is hard but bc of how the test is made
